text: Wilton "Scoop" Putnam (September 8, 1912 – June 8, 1996) was an American professional basketball player. He played in the National Basketball League for the Oshkosh All-Stars and Toledo Jim White Chevrolets and averaged 3.9 points per game for his career. == References == Category:1912 births Category:1996 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Basketball players from South Carolina Category:Forwards (basketball) Category:Guards (basketball) Category:Oshkosh All-Stars players Category:Sportspeople from Greenville, South Carolina Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles Category:Tennessee Volunteers basketball players Category:Toledo Jim White Chevrolets players
title: Scoop Putnam
